Secret Playhouse

(with a real swing-open door + privacy window)

Build a big foam cube, hinge one mat for the door, and hand over the keys. Kids can swing the whole door open for grand entrances or latch the bottom half shut and leave a single square “service window” for top-secret deliveries. Two occupants fit if they don't mind elbows; one child plus pillows and an art stash fits perfectly. Door closed, creativity closed-door-session engaged.

Details:

  • Estimated build time: ≈ 8 – 10 mins
  • Mats needed: ≈ 40 pcs
  • Difficulty: Easy

Perks

  • Full-size door that clicks shut — or half-shut for a peek-a-boo window
  • Floor space for solo tinkering or a two-kid summit
  • Quick to build, quicker to flatten when today's classified project wraps up

How to Build: Step-by-Step Photos

Step 1 - this is the floor piece: start with a 3x2 long rectangle
Step 2 - add a 2x2 square on the top of it
Step 3 - this is the back plane: add another 3x2 long rectangle on the right side
Step 4 - stand these two pieces up to stabilize each other
Step 5 - add another 2x2 square on the bottom and stand it up too
Step 6 - now add a 2x1 long piece to the left side of the front and stand it up
Step 7 - add another 2x1 long piece on the right side of the front and stand it up too
Step 8 - add a 1x2 piece in an additional row at the top corner
Step 9 - use that corner piece as base structure to expand an extra row to the other corner as well
Step 10 - make sure that the front side also is now expanded to 3 rows high
Step 11 - add a 2x3 ceiling on top to close up the house and close the 3rd row to form the door
Step 12 - add a 2x1 long piece as a swing-open door

Gear We Used (Affiliate Links)

  • Puzzle Play Mats(I started with 4 packs which has been enough for all the builds shown here. Of course, more mats = more building possibilities!)
